TopicTitle: First Two Kerbal Crews To Meet Up On The Moon :D

Articles.Content:
I decided to fly 2 missions to mun, one would land in the crater I had planned to land on in my next Mun mission that I planned before the .16 update. And a second one, where I would try and make a precise landing near the first

first lander. Well I was more than successful This presented a perfect opportunity to take a \'historical\' photo of the 6 intrepid kerbonauts, it makes a wonderful wallpaper.

Jeb approves 8) Or atleast I think he does...they all have emotionless expressions on their faces xD

EDIT: Accidently uploaded a 800x600 photo, attached the proper 1920x1080 one.
Is it just me that doesn\'t know how to get more than one kerbal out at once?
You have to press escape, go to the space center, and use the tracking station to switch back to the pod. It\'s a pain in the ass, but that\'s the only way so far.
It is easier if you set a button for switching between vessels in the options. It\'s more convenient than going back to the tracking station every time.
You can press [ or ] to cycle between them while in-game.
